page.title: List of Apple Inc. media events

revision.comment: Reverted [[WP:AGF|good faith]] edits by [[Special:Contributions/24.190.254.95|24.190.254.95]] ([[User talk:24.190.254.95|talk]]): More relevant image for events? ([[WP:TW|TW]])
revision.text:
{{short description|Wikipedia list article}} {{Use mdy dates|date=September 2015}} [[File:YBCA iPad 2 preparation.jpg|thumb|200px|The Yerba Buena Center for the Arts's exterior prepared in anticipation for the March 2, 2011, unveiling of Apple's [[iPad 2]]]] [[Apple Inc.]] announces new products, product redesigns and upgrades through press conferences that garner a significant following in traditional and online media.<ref name="3kinds">{{cite web|url=http://gadgetwise.blogs.nytimes.com/2012/03/07/there-are-three-kinds-of-apple-events/|title=There Are Three Kinds of Apple Events|publisher=[[New York Times]]|first=Sam|last=Grobart|access-date=March 8, 2012|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120308185907/http://gadgetwise.blogs.nytimes.com/2012/03/07/there-are-three-kinds-of-apple-events/|archive-date=March 8, 2012|url-status=live}}</ref> Often the purpose of the event is kept as a secret to create [[Marketing buzz|buzz]] and only unveiled during the event.<ref name="CNN secrets">{{cite news|url=http://money.cnn.com/2007/01/10/commentary/lewis_fortune_iphone.fortune/index.htm|title=How Apple kept its iPhone secrets|last=Lewis|first=Peter|date=January 12, 2007|publisher=[[CNN|CNN Money]]|accessdate=January 11, 2009|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081210110636/http://money.cnn.com/2007/01/10/commentary/lewis_fortune_iphone.fortune/index.htm|archive-date=December 10, 2008|url-status=live}}</ref> These events are usually streamed live on Apple's website.
==Venues== * [[Moscone West]], [[San Francisco]] * [[Yerba Buena Center for the Arts]], [[San Francisco]] * [[Bill Graham Civic Auditorium]], [[San Francisco]] * [[Flint Center]], [[Cupertino]] * [[Apple Park#Auditorium|Steve Jobs Theater]] ([[Apple Park]]), [[Cupertino]]
== 2005 ==
=== WWDC 2005 (June 6–10, 2005) === After a basic market update, Jobs announced that Apple would transition the Macintosh platform to [[Intel]] [[x86]] processors. The keynote featured developers from [[Wolfram Research]], who discussed their experience porting [[Mathematica]] to [[Mac OS X]] on the Intel platform. The conference consisted of 110 lab sessions and 95 presentation sessions, while more than 500 Apple engineers were on site alongside 3,800 attendees from 45 countries. The band [[The Wallflowers]] played at the Apple campus.
== 2006 == === Apple Special Event (February 28, 2006) ===
=== WWDC 2006 (August 7–11, 2006) === In 2006, Steve Jobs once again delivered the keynote presentation at the WWDC, which was held from August 7 to 11 in Moscone Center West, San Francisco. The [[Mac Pro]] was announced as a replacement for the [[Power Mac G5]], which was Apple's prior pro desktop computer and the last remaining [[PowerPC]]-based Mac. The standard Mac Pro featured two 2.66 GHz dual core Xeon (Woodcrest) processors, 1 GB RAM, 250 GB hard drive, and a 256 MB video card. An Xserve update, based on the dual core Xeons, was also announced. Redundant power and Lights Out Management were further product improvements to Apple's server lineup. While certain key [[macOS|Mac OS X]] improvements were undisclosed, there were 10 improvements in the next iteration, [[Mac OS X Leopard]] (10.5), including: full 64-bit app support, [[Time Machine (software)|Time Machine]], [[Boot Camp (software)|Boot Camp]], [[Front Row (software)|Front Row]], [[Photo Booth]], Spaces (Virtual Desktops), [[Spotlight (software)|Spotlight]] enhancements, Core Animation, Universal Access enhancements, [[Mail (OS X)|Mail]] enhancements, and [[Dashboard (Mac OS X)|Dashboard]] enhancements (including [[Dashcode]]), and [[iChat]] enhancements. Along with the Leopard features that were announced, a major revision to the Mac OS X Server product was announced. New features to the Server included: a simplified set-up process, [[iCal Server]] (based on the [[CalDAV]] standard), [[Apple Teams]] (a set of web-based collaborative services), Spotlight Server, and Podcast Producer. The 2006 WWDC attracted 4,200 developers from 48 countries, while there were 140 sessions and 100 hands-on labs for developers. More than 1,000 Apple engineers were present at the event, and the DJ [[BT (musician)|BT]] performed at the Apple Campus in Cupertino.{{Citation needed|date=August 2019}}
=== Apple Special Event (September 12, 2006) === Apple announced the [[Apple TV]] (code-named iTV at the time) at this event, along with refreshes to their [[iPod]] lineup.{{Citation needed|date=August 2019}}
== 2007 ==
=== Macworld Expo (January 9, 2007) === At the [[Macworld Expo]] on January 9, 2007, Steve Jobs announced that Apple Computer, Inc. would from that point on be known as Apple Inc., because computers were no longer the main focus of the company, which had shifted its emphasis to mobile electronic devices. The event also saw the announcement of the [[iPhone (1st generation)|iPhone]]. Apple also began taking orders for the [[Apple TV]].<ref name="MW2007">{{cite web|url=https://www.apple.com/hotnews/articles/2007/01/mwsf/ |title=Apple – Hot News – Macworld 2007 |publisher=Apple.com |accessdate=October 7, 2011 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101011223304/http://www.apple.com/hotnews/articles/2007/01/mwsf/ |archivedate=October 11, 2010 |df=mdy }}</ref> The following day, Apple shares hit $97.80, an all-time high at that point. In May, Apple's share price passed the $100 mark.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.macnn.com/articles/07/04/26/analyst.raised.aapl.target/|title=AAPL surges past $100, target at $140|website=MacNN|date=April 26, 2007|accessdate=July 10, 2007|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070629154237/http://www.macnn.com/articles/07/04/26/analyst.raised.aapl.target/|archive-date=June 29, 2007|url-status=live}}</ref>
== 2008 ==
=== WWDC 2008 (June 9–13, 2008) === Announcements at the keynote included the [[App Store (iOS)|App Store]] for iPhone and [[iPod Touch]], the stable version of the [[iPhone SDK]], a subsidized [[3G]] [[iPhone 3G|version]] of the iPhone for Worldwide markets, [[IOS version history|version 2.0]] of [[IOS|iPhone OS]], [[Mac OS X Snow Leopard]] (10.6), and the replacement/rebranding of .Mac as [[MobileMe]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.engadget.com/2008/06/09/tuaw-meta-liveblog-of-wwdc-08-keynote/|title=TUAW Meta-Liveblog of WWDC 08 Keynote|last=Sadun|first=Erica|date=June 9, 2008|website=[[Engadget]]|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170815063439/https://www.engadget.com/2008/06/09/tuaw-meta-liveblog-of-wwdc-08-keynote/|archive-date=August 15, 2017|url-status=live}}</ref>
== 2009 ==
=== WWDC 2009 (June 8–12, 2009) === Announcements at the keynote included the release of the [[IOS version history|iPhone OS 3.0]] software announced to developers in March, a demonstration of [[Mac OS X Snow Leopard]] (10.6), the new 13" [[MacBook Pro]], updates to the 15" and 17" MacBook Pros, and the new [[iPhone 3GS]].
== 2010 ==
=== Apple Special Event (January 27, 2010) === The [[iPad (1st generation)|iPad]] was announced on January 27, 2010, by [[Steve Jobs]] at an Apple press conference at the [[Yerba Buena Center for the Arts]] in San Francisco.<ref name="Apple PR-Jan">{{cite press release| url = https://www.apple.com/pr/library/2010/01/27ipad.html| title = Apple Launches iPad| publisher = Apple| date = January 27, 2010| accessdate = January 27, 2010| archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20100130164228/http://www.apple.com/pr/library/2010/01/27ipad.html| archive-date = January 30, 2010| url-status = live}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.nj.com/business/index.ssf/2010/01/apple_ipad_tablet_is_unveiled.html|title=Apple iPad tablet is unveiled at live press conference|work=[[The Star-Ledger]]|date=January 27, 2010|accessdate=January 27, 2010|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100129222937/http://www.nj.com/business/index.ssf/2010/01/apple_ipad_tablet_is_unveiled.html|archive-date=January 29, 2010|url-status=live}}</ref>
Jobs later said that Apple began developing the [[iPad]] before the [[iPhone]],<ref name="keynoteMacworld">{{cite web|last=Cohen|first=Peter|url=http://www.macworld.com/news/2007/01/09/liveupdate/index.php|title=Macworld Expo Keynote Live Update|website=[[Macworld]]|date=January 9, 2007|access-date=February 1, 2007|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070127110536/http://www.macworld.com/news/2007/01/09/liveupdate/index.php|archive-date=January 27, 2007|url-status=live}}</ref><ref name="keynoteEngadget">{{cite web|last=Block|first=Ryan|url=https://www.engadget.com/2007/01/09/live-from-macworld-2007-steve-jobs-keynote/|title=Live from Macworld 2007: Steve Jobs keynote]|website=Engadget|date=January 9, 2007|access-date=February 1, 2007|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170324084725/https://www.engadget.com/2007/01/09/live-from-macworld-2007-steve-jobs-keynote/|archive-date=March 24, 2017|url-status=live}}</ref><ref name=levgrossman>{{cite web|last=Grossman|first=Lev|url=http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,1576854,00.html|title=The Apple Of Your Ear|website=TIME|date=January 12, 2007|access-date=February 1, 2007|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070210113511/http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0%2C9171%2C1576854%2C00.html|archive-date=February 10, 2007|url-status=live}}</ref> but temporarily shelved the effort upon realizing that its ideas would work just as well in a mobile phone.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.foxnews.com/scitech/2010/06/02/jobs-says-ipad-idea-came-iphone/ | publisher=Fox News | title=Jobs Says iPad Idea Came Before iPhone | date=June 2, 2010 | access-date=March 8, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120528122230/http://www.foxnews.com/scitech/2010/06/02/jobs-says-ipad-idea-came-iphone/ | archive-date=May 28, 2012 | url-status=live }}</ref> The iPad's internal codename was K48, which was revealed in the court case surrounding leaking of iPad information before launch.<ref>{{cite news | url=https://dealbook.nytimes.com/2011/07/05/executive-pleads-guilty-to-leaking-apple-secrets/ | publisher=The New York Times | title=Executive Pleads Guilty to Leaking Apple Secrets | date=July 6, 2010 | first=Azam | last=Ahmed | access-date=March 5, 2017 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170709134821/https://dealbook.nytimes.com/2011/07/05/executive-pleads-guilty-to-leaking-apple-secrets/ | archive-date=July 9, 2017 | url-status=live }}</ref>
=== Apple Special Event (April 8, 2010) ===
Apple revealed [[iPhone OS 4]]. In Apple's description, it includes "over 100 new user features for [[iPhone]] and [[iPod touch]] owners to enjoy. And for developers, a new software development kit (SDK) offers over 1500 new APIs to create apps that are even more powerful, innovative, and amazing."<ref>{{cite web|title=iTunes - Apple Keynotes|url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/apple-keynotes/id275834665?mt=2|publisher=Apple|access-date=June 10, 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170613174109/https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/apple-keynotes/id275834665?mt=2|archive-date=June 13, 2017|url-status=live}}</ref>
=== WWDC 2010 (June 7–11, 2010) === On June 7, 2010, Jobs announced the [[iPhone 4]]. Also, iPhone OS was renamed to [[iOS]]. The [[FaceTime]] and [[iMovie]] app for iPhone applications were also announced.
=== Apple Special Event (September 1, 2010) === Steve Jobs opened iOS 4.1, iOS 4.2 Preview, 4th gen Shuffle, 6th gen nano, 4th gen iPod touch, iTunes 10 with Ping. and 2nd gen apple TV.
== 2011 ==
=== Apple Special Event (March 2, 2011) === Apple sent invitations to journalists on February 23, 2011, for a media event on March 2.<ref name="Feb. 23 invite">{{cite news|title=Apple iPad 2 to be unveiled on March 2|url=http://articles.economictimes.indiatimes.com/2011-02-26/news/28636008_1_ipad-galaxy-tab-front-facing-camera|publisher=Bennett, Coleman & Co.|accessdate=March 20, 2010|author=Hitesh Raj Bhagat, ET Bureau|date=February 26, 2011|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120121125235/http://articles.economictimes.indiatimes.com/2011-02-26/news/28636008_1_ipad-galaxy-tab-front-facing-camera|archive-date=January 21, 2012|url-status=live}}</ref> Apple CEO [[Steve Jobs]] revealed the [[iPad 2]] device at the [[Yerba Buena Center for the Arts]] on March 2, 2011, despite being on medical leave.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2011/01/18/technology/18apple.html?_r=1|title=Apple Says Steve Jobs Will Take a New Medical Leave|first=Miguel|last=Helft|work=The New York Times|date=January 17, 2011|accessdate=January 17, 2011|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121110062146/http://www.nytimes.com/2011/01/18/technology/18apple.html?_r=1|archive-date=November 10, 2012|url-status=live}}</ref><ref name="PCWorldiOS43">{{cite web | url=https://www.pcworld.com/article/221324/ios_43_garageband_and_imovie_what_you_need_to_know.html | title=IOS 4.3, GarageBand, and IMovie: What You Need to Know | accessdate=March 4, 2011 | publisher=PCWorld | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111019215619/http://www.pcworld.com/article/221324/ios_43_garageband_and_imovie_what_you_need_to_know.html | archive-date=October 19, 2011 | url-status=live }}</ref>
=== WWDC 2011 (June 6–10, 2011) === Apple unveiled [[Mac OS X Lion]], [[iOS 5]], the cloud service [[iCloud]] and [[iTunes#iTunes in the Cloud and iTunes Match|iTunes Match]].
This keynote was not streamed live.
=== Apple Special Event (October 4, 2011) === On October 4, 2011, Apple held a media event in which it introduced [[Find My Friends]], refreshed the [[iPod Nano]] and [[iPod touch]], and revealed the [[iPhone 4s]] with its all-new [[Siri (software)|Siri]] voice assistant.
== 2012 ==
=== Apple Special Event (March 7, 2012) === On February 28, 2012, Apple announced a media event scheduled for March 7, 2012, at the Yerba Buena Center. Apple didn't disclose in advance what would be announced at the event, but it was widely expected to be a new version of the [[iPad]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.arnnet.com.au/article/417010/ipad_3_local_analysts_all_agree_-_it_coming/ |title=IPad 3: Local analysts all agree - it's coming |first=Patrick |last=Budmar |date=February 28, 2012 |work=The Verge |accessdate=March 1, 2012 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120305004037/http://www.arnnet.com.au/article/417010/ipad_3_local_analysts_all_agree_-_it_coming/ |archive-date=March 5, 2012 |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://9to5mac.com/2012/03/02/apple-prepares-yerba-buena-center-for-next-gen-ipad-unveiling/#more-142784 | title=Apple prepares Yerba Buena Center for March 7 next-gen iPad unveiling | website=[[9to5Mac]] | date=March 2, 2012 | accessdate=March 11, 2012 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120305234553/http://9to5mac.com/2012/03/02/apple-prepares-yerba-buena-center-for-next-gen-ipad-unveiling/#more-142784 | archive-date=March 5, 2012 | url-status=live }}</ref><ref name=CNET>{{cite web|url=https://www.cnet.com/news/apple-sends-out-invites-for-march-7-ipad-event/|publisher=CNET|author=Lowensohn, Josh|date=February 28, 2012|accessdate=August 14, 2019|title=Apple sends out invites for March 7 iPad event}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Vancouver Sun|url=https://vancouversun.com/business/innovation/faster+Apple+iPad+expected+March/6222959/story.html|publisher=Vancouver Sun|accessdate=March 1, 2012}}</ref> It was also rumored that Apple might release a new [[television]] [[set top box]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Apple TV|url=https://www.latimes.com/business/technology/la-fi-tn-new-apple-tv-settop-box-rumored-for-launch-alongside-ipad-3-20120229,0,7800251.story|publisher=LA Times|accessdate=March 4, 2012|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120303223626/http://www.latimes.com/business/technology/la-fi-tn-new-apple-tv-settop-box-rumored-for-launch-alongside-ipad-3-20120229,0,7800251.story|archive-date=March 3, 2012|url-status=live}}</ref> The announcement affected the tablet resale market,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.computerworld.com/s/article/9224763/Looming_iPad_3_launch_sparks_tablet_trade_in_stampede |title=Looming iPad 3 launch sparks tablet trade-in stampede |first=Gregg |last=Keizer |date=February 29, 2012 |work=The Verge |accessdate=March 1, 2012 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120229205516/http://www.computerworld.com/s/article/9224763/Looming_iPad_3_launch_sparks_tablet_trade_in_stampede |archive-date=February 29, 2012 |url-status=live }}</ref> and Apple's stock price reached a record closing figure on the same day that the [[Dow Jones Industrial Average]] reached a closing figure of above 13,000 for the first time since the [[Global Financial Crisis]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.mercurynews.com/60-second-business-break/ci_20063335?source=most_viewed |title=Biz Break: iPad 3 announcement sends Apple to new high as Dow closes atop 13,000 |first=Jeremy |last=Owens |date=February 28, 2012 |work=Mercury News |accessdate=March 1, 2012 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120301064452/http://www.mercurynews.com/60-second-business-break/ci_20063335?source=most_viewed |archive-date=March 1, 2012 |url-status=live }}</ref> (Apple is not a Dow Jones component.)
The keynote began 10 AM PST (18:00 UTC) with Cook introducing [[iOS version history#iOS 5.x: fifth major OS release|iOS 5.1]], a Japanese version of [[Siri (software)|Siri]], and the 3rd generation [[Apple TV]] before the [[iPad (3rd generation)|3rd generation iPad]].<ref>{{cite web | url=http://news.cnet.com/8301-13579_3-57390897-37/apple-ipad-live-blog-wednesday-march-7/ | title=Apple iPad live blog (Wednesday, March 7) | publisher=Cnet | date=March 7, 2012 | accessdate=March 16, 2012 | author=Lowensohn, Josh | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120307194834/http://news.cnet.com/8301-13579_3-57390897-37/apple-ipad-live-blog-wednesday-march-7/ | archive-date=March 7, 2012 | url-status=live }}</ref> [[Eddy Cue]] gave a demo of the new Apple TV interface. At the media event, Cook talked about a 'post-PC world', a world where the personal computer is no longer the center of one's digital life, and of how the 3rd generation iPad will be one of the main contributors of the 'post-PC world'.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cultofmac.com/152080/why-apple-will-crush-microsoft-in-the-post-pc-era/ |title=Why Apple will crush Microsoft in the Post-PC era |first=Mike |last=Elgan |date=March 10, 2012 |work=Cult of Mac |accessdate=March 13, 2012 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120313031911/http://www.cultofmac.com/152080/why-apple-will-crush-microsoft-in-the-post-pc-era/ |archive-date=March 13, 2012 |url-status=live }}</ref>
=== WWDC 2012 (June 11–15, 2012) ===
WWDC 2012 was held in Moscone Center West from June 11 to 15. The ticket price remained the same as the 2010 WWDC, selling at US$1,599. Apple changed the purchasing process by requiring purchases to be made using an Apple ID associated with a paid Apple developer account. Tickets went on sale shortly after 8:30am Eastern Time on Wednesday April 25, 2012, and were sold out within 1 hour and 43 minutes. The keynote highlighted the launch of [[Apple Maps]], and also announced new models of the [[MacBook Air]] and [[MacBook Pro]] including one with [[Retina Display]]. Apple also showcased [[OS X Mountain Lion]] and [[iOS 6]].
In prior years, attendees were required to be at least 18 years old. In 2012, Apple changed this requirement to at least 13 years after a minor who was "accidentally" awarded a student scholarship in 2011 successfully petitioned Tim Cook to retain the award. Despite the change, Beer Bash attendees were still required to be 18 years old, and 21 years old to consume alcohol, in accord with local and federal laws. [[Neon Trees]] performed at the WWDC Bash.
This keynote was streamed live exclusively on iOS devices and OS X, through the [[Safari (web browser)|Safari]] web browser on June 11, 2012.
=== Apple Special Event (September 12, 2012) === [[Phil Schiller]], Apple's senior vice president of worldwide marketing, took the wraps off the new [[iPhone]] for press gathered at the company's San Francisco event, calling the device "the most beautiful product we've ever made, bar none." The [[iPhone 5]] is made entirely of glass and aluminum, Schiller said, adding that the "exacting level of standards" exhibited by the phone is Apple's best hardware engineering to date.
It's the thinnest and lightest iPhone, at 7.6mm thin, and 112 grams. Schiller said those measurements make it the world's thinnest smartphone. The [[iPhone 5]] was also volumetrically smaller than the previous model, the [[iPhone 4S]].
=== Apple Special Event (October 23, 2012) === On October 23, Apple CEO Tim Cook unveiled the new [[iPad Mini (1st generation)|iPad Mini]], [[iPad 4|fourth generation iPad]] with Retina display, new [[iMac]], and the 13-inch [[MacBook Pro]] with Retina display.
== 2013 ==
=== WWDC 2013 (June 10–14, 2013) === In 2013, WWDC 2013 was held from June 10 to 14, 2013, at Moscone West in San Francisco – the same venue as in previous years.<ref name="engadget wwdc13 announced">{{cite web | url=https://www.engadget.com/2013/04/24/apple-wwdc-2013-announced | title=Apple confirms WWDC 2013 will take place June 10th to 14th, tickets go on sale tomorrow | website=Engadget | date=April 24, 2013 | accessdate=October 8, 2013 | last=Melanson | first=Donald | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131009204844/http://www.engadget.com/2013/04/24/apple-wwdc-2013-announced/ | archive-date=October 9, 2013 | url-status=live }}</ref><ref name="ars wwdc13 announced">{{cite web|url=https://arstechnica.com/apple/2013/04/apple-mixes-things-up-for-wwdc-2013-pre-announced-ticket-sales|title=Apple mixes things up for WWDC 2013, with pre-announced ticket sales|first=Jacqui|last=Cheng|publisher=Ars Technica|date=April 24, 2013|accessdate=April 24, 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130425021730/http://arstechnica.com/apple/2013/04/apple-mixes-things-up-for-wwdc-2013-pre-announced-ticket-sales/|archive-date=April 25, 2013|url-status=live}}</ref> Tickets went on sale at 10am [[Pacific Daylight Time|PDT]] on April 25, 2013,<ref name="engadget wwdc13 announced"/><ref name="ars wwdc13 announced"/> selling out within 71 seconds (1 minute and 11 seconds).<ref name="ars wwdc13 sold out">{{cite web|url=https://arstechnica.com/apple/2013/04/apples-wwdc-2013-tickets-sold-out-in-a-record-two-minutes|title=Apple’s WWDC 2013 tickets sold out in a record two minutes (or less)|first=Jacqui|last=Cheng|publisher=Ars Technica|date=April 25, 2013|accessdate=April 25, 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130426001457/http://arstechnica.com/apple/2013/04/apples-wwdc-2013-tickets-sold-out-in-a-record-two-minutes/|archive-date=April 26, 2013|url-status=live}}</ref> Apple also announced that it will award 150 free WWDC 2013 Student Scholarship tickets to those who want to attend in order to benefit from the conference's many workshops, with applications for a scholarship starting 9am PDT on April 29, 2013, and deadline slated for 5pm PDT on May 2, 2013.<ref name="ars free tickets">{{cite web|url=https://arstechnica.com/apple/2013/04/apple-to-hand-out-150-free-wwdc-tickets-to-budding-young-developers|title=Apple to hand out 150 free WWDC tickets to budding young developers|first=Florence|last=Ion|publisher=Ars Technica|date=April 24, 2013|accessdate=April 24, 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130425021707/http://arstechnica.com/apple/2013/04/apple-to-hand-out-150-free-wwdc-tickets-to-budding-young-developers/|archive-date=April 25, 2013|url-status=live}}</ref> Winning applicants were notified by May 16, 2013, though Apple states that it won't reimburse winners for travel or hotel expenses.<ref name="ars free tickets"/> In the keynote, Apple unveiled a redesigned model of the [[Mac Pro]], [[AirPort Time Capsule]], and [[AirPort Extreme]] as well as updated models of the [[MacBook Air]]. Apple also showcased [[OS X Mavericks]], [[iOS 7]], [[iWork for iCloud]] and a new music streaming service named [[iTunes Radio]].<ref>{{cite web |last=Rodriguez |first=Salvador |url=https://www.latimes.com/business/technology/la-fi-tn-apples-wwdc-2013-roundup-20130610,0,3961886.story |title=Top features, products unveiled at Apple's WWDC 2013 Video chat |publisher=latimes.com |date=June 10, 2013 |accessdate=July 8, 2013 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130613143407/http://www.latimes.com/business/technology/la-fi-tn-apples-wwdc-2013-roundup-20130610,0,3961886.story |archive-date=June 13, 2013 |url-status=live }}</ref> [[Vampire Weekend]] performed at the Bash on June 13 at the Yerba Buena Gardens.
This keynote was streamed live on June 10, 2013.
=== Apple Special Event (September 10, 2013) === Apple announced the [[iPhone 5C]] and [[iPhone 5S]] during a media event called "This should brighten everyone's day."<ref name=cnet-sept-2013-event-invitations>{{cite news |last=Svetlik |first=Joe |date=September 4, 2013 |title=Apple 10 September iPhone event is official, invites go out |url=https://www.cnet.com/news/apple-10-september-iphone-event-is-official-invites-go-out/ |website=[[CNET]] |access-date=September 28, 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150930234505/http://www.cnet.com/news/apple-10-september-iphone-event-is-official-invites-go-out/ |archive-date=September 30, 2015 |url-status=live }}</ref> at its [[Cupertino]] headquarters on September 10, 2013.<ref name="techradar confirmed 5S release 1">{{cite web|url=http://www.techradar.com/news/phone-and-communications/mobile-phones/apple-iphone-5s-launch-confirmed-for-september-10-1176259%7C|title=Apple iPhone 5S launch confirmed for September 10|publisher=[[Future plc]]|work=[[TechRadar]]|date=September 10, 2013|accessdate=September 10, 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304060513/http://www.techradar.com/news/phone-and-communications/mobile-phones/apple-iphone-5s-launch-confirmed-for-september-10-1176259%7C|archive-date=March 4, 2016|url-status=live}}</ref><ref name="verge 5S unveil">{{cite web|url=https://www.theverge.com/2013/9/10/4713720/apple-iphone-5s-release-date-price-cost|title=The iPhone 5S: fingerprint sensor and improved camera, starts at $199 and coming September 20th|work=[[The Verge (website)|The Verge]]|date=September 10, 2013|accessdate=September 10, 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130910204201/http://www.theverge.com/2013/9/10/4713720/apple-iphone-5s-release-date-price-cost|archive-date=September 10, 2013|url-status=live}}</ref> While the iPhone 5C became available for preorder on September 13, 2013, the iPhone 5S first became available on September 20, 2013.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/markrogowsky/2013/09/13/one-new-iphone-is-ready-for-pre-order-yes-just-one|title=One New iPhone Is Ready For Pre-Order; Yes, Just One|publisher=Forbes, Inc.|work=[[Forbes]]|first=Mark|last=Rogowsky|date=September 13, 2013|accessdate=September 13, 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130916004216/http://www.forbes.com/sites/markrogowsky/2013/09/13/one-new-iphone-is-ready-for-pre-order-yes-just-one/|archive-date=September 16, 2013|url-status=live}}</ref> While most of the promotion focused on [[Touch ID]], the 64-bit [[Apple A7]] was also a highlight during the event:
{{quote|"This is the first-ever 64-bit processor in a phone of any kind. I don't think the other guys are even talking about it yet. Why go through all this? The benefits are huge. The A7 is up to twice as fast as the previous-generation system at CPU tasks, and up to twice as fast at graphics tasks, too."|[[Phil Schiller]]|Apple keynote at [[4 Infinite Loop]] on September 10, 2013<ref name="64bit">{{cite web|url=http://allthingsd.com/20130913/apples-iphone-5s-the-a7-chip-and-that-64-bit-question/?refcat=news|title=Apple’s iPhone 5S, the A7 Chip, and That 64-Bit Question|publisher=[[Dow Jones & Company]]|work=[[All Things Digital]]|first=John|last=Paczkowski|authorlink=John Paczkowski|date=September 13, 2013|accessdate=September 16, 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130917000819/http://allthingsd.com/20130913/apples-iphone-5s-the-a7-chip-and-that-64-bit-question/?refcat=news|archive-date=September 17, 2013|url-status=live}}</ref>}}
Schiller then showed demos of ''[[Infinity Blade III]]'' to demonstrate the A7's processing power and the iPhone 5S camera using unretouched photographs.<ref name="usatodayrecap"/> The release of [[iOS 7]] on September 18, 2013, was also announced during the keynote.<ref name="usatodayrecap">{{cite web|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/tech/personal/2013/09/10/apple-iphone-live-coverage/2791683|title=Recap: Apple unveils iPhone 5S, 5C smartphones|publisher=[[Gannett Company]]|work=[[USA Today]]|first=Marco Della|last=Cava|date=September 10, 2013|accessdate=September 16, 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130915050036/http://www.usatoday.com/story/tech/personal/2013/09/10/apple-iphone-live-coverage/2791683/|archive-date=September 15, 2013|url-status=live}}</ref>
=== Apple Special Event (October 22, 2013) === Apple held a second Fall event in 2013 under the name of "We still have a lot to cover".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://mashable.com/2013/10/22/ipad-air-event-everything/#dDm6CwjBMaqi|title=Apple iPad Air Event: Everything You Need to Know|first=Christina|last=Warren|date=October 22, 2013|website=[[Mashable]]|access-date=September 8, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180909000419/https://mashable.com/2013/10/22/ipad-air-event-everything/#dDm6CwjBMaqi|archive-date=September 9, 2018|url-status=live}}</ref> This event saw the unveiling of the [[iPad Air]], the second-generation [[iPad mini with Retina display]], and updates to the [[MacBook Pro]] line. Tim Cook also announced that [[OS X Mavericks]] would be available for free.
== 2014 ==
=== WWDC 2014 (June 2–6, 2014) === At Moscone West, Apple presented the new version of [[OS X]] named [[OS X Yosemite|Yosemite]] as well as the new [[iOS]] version, [[iOS 8]]. The biggest news however was the completely new programming language for Mac and iOS called [[Swift (programming language)|Swift]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.apple.com/apple-events/june-2014/|title=Apple - Apple Events - Special Event June 2014|work=apple.com|access-date=September 8, 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140528144620/https://www.apple.com/apple-events/june-2014/|archive-date=May 28, 2014|url-status=live}}</ref>
This keynote was streamed live on June 2, 2014.
=== Apple Special Event (September 9, 2014) === Presented on the "Wish we could say more" event was the most anticipated<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theverge.com/2014/8/28/6078801/apple-officially-holding-event-september-9th-wish-we-could-say-more|title=Apple officially holding event September 9th: 'wish we could say more'|publisher=Vox Media|work=The Verge|access-date=August 30, 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170812022617/https://www.theverge.com/2014/8/28/6078801/apple-officially-holding-event-september-9th-wish-we-could-say-more|archive-date=August 12, 2017|url-status=live}}</ref> [[iPhone 6|iPhone 6 and 6 Plus]] as well as a new payment system called [[Apple Pay]]. Also, the [[Apple Watch]], the company's first [[smartwatch]], was introduced. The event took place at [[Flint Center]], in Cupertino.
=== Apple Special Event (October 16, 2014) ===
Apple's "It's been way too long" media event took place on October 16, 2014.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://thenextweb.com/apple/2014/10/16/everything-apple-announced-ipad-mac-event/|title=Everything Apple announced at its iPad and Mac event|first=Natt|last=Garun|date=October 16, 2014|website=Thenextweb|access-date=September 8, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180909035449/https://thenextweb.com/apple/2014/10/16/everything-apple-announced-ipad-mac-event/|archive-date=September 9, 2018|url-status=live}}</ref> The company used this event to unveil the [[iPad Air 2]], [[iPad mini 3]], and an updated [[iMac]] with a 5K [[Retina Display]].
This keynote was streamed live on October 16, 2014.
== 2015 ==
=== Apple Special Event (March 9, 2015) === Apple Special Event 2015 had the tagline "Spring Forward" and was broadcast live from [[Cupertino]] on [[Apple Inc.|Apple]]'s website on March 9, 2015. It announced the release date and pricing for the anticipated [[Apple Watch]], the [[MacBook]]'s fourth redesign and [[iOS 8.2]]'s same day release.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Etherington|first1=Darrell|title=Tim Cook Says Apple Watch Ships In April|url=https://techcrunch.com/2015/01/27/tim-cook-says-apple-watch-should-ship-in-april/|website=TechCrunch|publisher=AOL|accessdate=January 28, 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150427204809/http://techcrunch.com/2015/01/27/tim-cook-says-apple-watch-should-ship-in-april/|archive-date=April 27, 2015|url-status=live}}</ref> Apple also announced ResearchKit, a library designed to enable researchers to make study applications where participants can download them on their phones, electronic enroll & consent, and send survey and sensor data. Five launch studies were introduced, including [[Euan Ashley|My Heart Counts]], which enrolled over 11,000 participants in a single day.<ref>{{cite web|title=Get ready for an explosion of ResearchKit apps collecting health data|url=https://www.macworld.com/article/2909749/get-ready-for-an-explosion-of-researchkit-apps-collecting-health-data.html|access-date=September 20, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180921034444/https://www.macworld.com/article/2909749/get-ready-for-an-explosion-of-researchkit-apps-collecting-health-data.html|archive-date=September 21, 2018|url-status=live}}</ref>
=== WWDC 2015 (June 8–12, 2015) === WWDC 2015 was held from June 8 to 12, 2015 in Moscone Center West in San Francisco. The major announcements were the new features of [[iOS 9]], the next version of OS X called [[OS X El Capitan]], the first major software update to the [[Apple Watch]], the June 30 debut of [[Apple Music]], and news that the programming language [[Swift (programming language)|Swift]] was becoming [[open-source software]] supporting [[iOS]], [[macOS|OS X]], and [[Linux]]. The Beer Bash was held at the Yerba Buena Gardens on June 11. [[Walk the Moon]] performed there.
This keynote was streamed live on June 8, 2015.
=== Apple Special Event (September 9, 2015) ===
The "Hey Siri, give us a hint" event<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.apple.com/apple-events/september-2015/|title=Apple Events - Special Event September 2015|work=apple.com|access-date=September 8, 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180506182445/https://www.apple.com/apple-events/september-2015/|archive-date=May 6, 2018|url-status=dead}}</ref><ref name="cnet-hey-siri-event-invitations">{{cite news |last=Tibken |first=Shara |date=August 27, 2015 |title=Apple will host next iPhone launch Sept. 9 |url=https://www.cnet.com/news/apple-will-host-next-iphone-launch-sept-9/ |website=[[CNET]] |access-date=September 14, 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150914135947/http://www.cnet.com/news/apple-will-host-next-iphone-launch-sept-9/ |archive-date=September 14, 2015 |url-status=live }}</ref> was held at the 7,000-seat [[Bill Graham Civic Auditorium]] in [[San Francisco]]. Apple announced and previewed [[watchOS]] 2 with native apps; the long-anticipated [[Apple TV]] update - with [[App Store (iOS)|App Store]], [[Siri Remote]] and [[tvOS]]; [[iPhone 6S]] and [[iPhone 6S Plus]] with the [[Apple A9]], [[3D Touch]], 12MP camera; [[iOS 9]] update coming September 16; and [[iPad Mini 4]] together with [[iPad Pro]] with 12.9" Retina display, optional keyboard/cover, and the [[Apple Pencil]] stylus. [[OneRepublic]] performed at the event.<ref name="cnet-hey-siri-event-summary">{{cite news |last=Grunin |first=Lori |date=September 9, 2015 |title=iPhone 6S, Apple TV 2015 and iPad Pro: All the cool stuff Apple just announced |url=https://www.cnet.com/news/iphone-6s-apple-tv-2015-and-ipad-pro-all-the-cool-stuff-apple-just-announced/ |website=[[CNET]] |access-date=September 23, 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150924225601/http://www.cnet.com/news/iphone-6s-apple-tv-2015-and-ipad-pro-all-the-cool-stuff-apple-just-announced/ |archive-date=September 24, 2015 |url-status=live }}</ref>
This keynote was streamed live on September 9, 2015. For the first time, Windows users were able to watch it live using Microsoft Edge, the native Windows 10 browser.
== 2016 ==
=== Apple Special Event (March 21, 2016) === Apple invited the press media for its event "Let us loop you in" on March 10, 2016 in their own theatre "Town Hall" (at [[1 Infinite Loop]]).<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://appadvice.com/post/what-to-expect-at-apples-let-us-loop-you-in-march-21-media-event/707002|title=What to expect at Apple's 'Let us loop you in' March 21 media event|last=Author|first=AppAdvice Staff|newspaper=AppAdvice|language=en-US|access-date=2017-01-02|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170103094216/https://appadvice.com/post/what-to-expect-at-apples-let-us-loop-you-in-march-21-media-event/707002|archive-date=January 3, 2017|url-status=live}}</ref> [[iPad Pro| iPad Pro (9.7-inch)]], the [[iPhone SE (1st generation)|first-generation iPhone SE]], CareKit and updates to [[Apple Watch]], [[HealthKit]], ResearchKit and [[tvOS]] were released.
=== WWDC 2016 (June 13–17, 2016) === Apple invited the press media and developers for its event on June 13, 2016 at [[Moscone West]] to unveil new versions of [[iOS]], [[watchOS]], [[tvOS]], and [[macOS]], a revamped [[Apple Music]] design, and the [[Swift Playgrounds]] app - a learning tool for programming.
This keynote was streamed live on June 13, 2016.
=== Apple Special Event (September 7, 2016) === Apple hosted a media event on September 7, 2016 with the invitation's tagline "See you on the 7th".<ref name="sept2016invite">{{cite web|last1=Kastrenakes|first1=Jacob|title=Apple iPhone 7 Event is Happening on September 7th|url=https://www.theverge.com/2016/8/29/12429510/apple-iphone-7-event-date-announced|website=The Verge|accessdate=29 August 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170801120354/https://www.theverge.com/2016/8/29/12429510/apple-iphone-7-event-date-announced|archive-date=August 1, 2017|url-status=live}}</ref> [[iPhone 7|iPhone 7 and 7 Plus]] were announced along with Apple's new wireless [[AirPods]]. [[iOS 10]] was also released. [[Sia (musician)|Sia]] performed at the event.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/580603/hashtag/sia-performs-the-greatest-at-iphone7-launch/|title=WATCH: Sia performs ‘The Greatest’ at iPhone7 launch|website=GMA News Online|access-date=2017-09-16}}</ref>
=== Apple Special Event (October 27, 2016) === Apple hosted a media event on October 27, 2016 with the tagline "hello again".<ref name="oct2016invite">{{cite web|title=Apple’s expected Mac event on October 27 is official: ‘hello again’|url=https://9to5mac.com/2016/10/19/apple-october-event-official/|website=9to5Mac|accessdate=19 October 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161020163330/https://9to5mac.com/2016/10/19/apple-october-event-official/|archive-date=October 20, 2016|url-status=live}}</ref> A new generation of [[MacBook Pro]] was announced.
== 2017 ==
===WWDC 2017 (June 5–9, 2017)===
The 2017 Apple WWDC was held from 5–9 June 2017 in [[San Jose, California]] at its [[San Jose Convention Center|Convention Center]]. An all-new [[iPad Pro#Second generation|second generation iPad Pro]] model was introduced with thinner bezels and a 10.5-inch screen size. It acquired many of the specs from the [[iPhone 7]] and an [[Apple A10X|A10X]] chip. The iPad Pro 12.9-inch was also refreshed with updated internals. [[iOS 11]] was announced, with a developer beta released just after. Apple previewed many new Macs such as the [[MacBook]], [[MacBook Pro]], [[iMac]], and an all-new [[iMac Pro]]. Apple's final announcement was [[HomePod]].
=== Apple Special Event (September 12, 2017) ===
Apple hosted a media event on September 12, 2017, with the tagline "Let's meet at our place". The tagline was a reference to Apple holding its first-ever event at the newly completed [[Steve Jobs Theater]] in the [[Apple Park]] campus.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Gartenberg|first1=Chaim|title=Apple’s iPhone 8 event is happening on September 12th|url=https://www.theverge.com/2017/8/31/16233998/apple-iphone-8-event-september-12th-invitation|website=The Verge|accessdate=31 August 2017|date=31 August 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170831183143/https://www.theverge.com/2017/8/31/16233998/apple-iphone-8-event-september-12th-invitation|archive-date=August 31, 2017|url-status=live}}</ref> At the event, [[Apple Watch Series 3]], [[Apple TV 4K]], [[iPhone 8|iPhone 8 and 8 Plus]], and [[iPhone X]] were announced. The release dates of [[iOS 11]] and [[watchOS|watchOS 4]] were also announced.
==2018== ===Apple Special Event (March 27, 2018)=== Apple hosted a media event on March 27 at the [[Lane Technical College Prep High School]] in [[Chicago]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.theverge.com/2018/3/16/17129108/apple-event-education-students-teachers-ipads|title=Apple announces March 27th event focusing on education|last=Gartenberg|first=Chaim|date=March 16, 2018|website=The Verge|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180316172753/https://www.theverge.com/2018/3/16/17129108/apple-event-education-students-teachers-ipads|archive-date=March 16, 2018|url-status=live|access-date=March 17, 2018}}</ref> The [[IPad (2018)|2018 iPad]] was announced at the education-focused event.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.theverge.com/2018/3/27/17155688/apple-event-2018-news-highlights-recap-ipad-education|title=The 5 biggest announcements from the Apple education event|work=The Verge|access-date=2018-03-27|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180327212401/https://www.theverge.com/2018/3/27/17155688/apple-event-2018-news-highlights-recap-ipad-education|archive-date=March 27, 2018|url-status=live}}</ref>
===WWDC 2018 (June 4–8, 2018)=== WWDC 2018 was held from June 4–8, 2018 at the [[San Jose Convention Center]] in [[California]].<ref>{{cite press release|url=https://www.apple.com/newsroom/2018/03/apples-worldwide-developers-conference-kicks-off-june-4-in-san-jose/|title=Apple’s Worldwide Developers Conference kicks off June 4 in San Jose|date=March 13, 2018|publisher=Apple Inc.|access-date=March 16, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180317035953/https://www.apple.com/newsroom/2018/03/apples-worldwide-developers-conference-kicks-off-june-4-in-san-jose/|archive-date=March 17, 2018|url-status=live}}</ref> The announcements at the event included [[iOS 12]], [[macOS Mojave]], [[WatchOS#watchOS 5.x|watchOS 5]], and updates to [[tvOS]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.theverge.com/2018/6/4/17410820/apple-wwdc-summary-updates-highlights-news-2018|title=The 6 biggest highlights from Apple WWDC 2018|work=The Verge|access-date=2018-06-07|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180609095725/https://www.theverge.com/2018/6/4/17410820/apple-wwdc-summary-updates-highlights-news-2018|archive-date=June 9, 2018|url-status=live}}</ref> [[Panic! at the Disco]] performed at the Bash at Discovery Meadow Park.
===Apple Special Event (September 12, 2018)=== Apple hosted a media event on September 12, 2018, with the tagline "Gather round". It was held at the [[Steve Jobs Theater]] in the [[Apple Park]] campus. The [[Apple Watch#Fourth generation|Apple Watch Series 4]], the [[iPhone XS|iPhone XS and XS Max]], and the [[iPhone XR]] were announced at this event.
===Apple Special Event (October 30, 2018)=== Apple hosted a media event on October 30, 2018, with the tagline "There's more in the making." It was held at the [[Brooklyn Academy of Music]] in [[Brooklyn]], [[New York City]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://sixcolors.com/post/2018/10/its-official-apple-event-october-30-in-brooklyn/|title=It’s official: Apple event October 30, in Brooklyn!|last=Snell|first=Jason|date=October 18, 2018|website=Six Colors|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181018201917/https://sixcolors.com/post/2018/10/its-official-apple-event-october-30-in-brooklyn/|archive-date=October 18, 2018|url-status=live|access-date=October 18, 2018}}</ref> The new [[MacBook Air]] 2018 model, [[Mac Mini]] 2018 model, and the 11-inch and 12.9-inch [[iPad Pro#|third generation iPad Pro]] were announced at this event.
==2019==
===Apple Special Event (March 25, 2019)=== Apple hosted a media event on March 25, 2019, with the tagline "It's show time." It was held at the [[Steve Jobs Theater]] in the [[Apple Park]] campus.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.theverge.com/2019/3/11/18260515/apple-tv-service-march-25th-event-streaming-announcement-invitation|title=Apple confirms March 25th event, expected to announce new TV service|work=[[The Verge]]|last=Gartenberg|first=Chaim|date=11 March 2019|accessdate=11 March 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190312012030/https://www.theverge.com/2019/3/11/18260515/apple-tv-service-march-25th-event-streaming-announcement-invitation|archive-date=March 12, 2019|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.cnbc.com/2019/03/11/apple-announces-march-25-event-video-and-news-services-expected.html|title=Apple announces event for March 25th where streaming TV and subscription news services are expected|work=[[CNBC]]|last=Haselton|first=Todd|date=11 March 2019|accessdate=11 March 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190312012241/https://www.cnbc.com/2019/03/11/apple-announces-march-25-event-video-and-news-services-expected.html|archive-date=March 12, 2019|url-status=live}}</ref> [[Apple News+]], [[Apple Card]], [[Apple Arcade]] and [[Apple TV+]] were announced at this event.
===WWDC 2019 (June 3–7, 2019)===
WWDC 2019 was held from June 3–7, 2019 at the San Jose Convention Center in California.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theverge.com/2019/3/14/18265689/apple-wwdc-2019-dates-worldwide-developer-conference-june|title=Apple’s WWDC 2019 will kick off on June 3rd|author=Dieter Bohn|date=March 14, 2019|website=[[The Verge]]|access-date=March 15, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190314201244/https://www.theverge.com/2019/3/14/18265689/apple-wwdc-2019-dates-worldwide-developer-conference-june|archive-date=March 14, 2019|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite press release|url=https://www.apple.com/newsroom/2019/03/apple-to-host-annual-worldwide-developers-conference-june-3-7-in-san-jose/|title=Apple to host annual Worldwide Developers Conference June 3–7 in San Jose|date=March 14, 2019|access-date=March 15, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190315012356/https://www.apple.com/newsroom/2019/03/apple-to-host-annual-worldwide-developers-conference-june-3-7-in-san-jose/|archive-date=March 15, 2019|url-status=live}}</ref> At the keynote that kicked off the event, Apple announced [[iOS 13]], [[iPadOS]], [[macOS Catalina]], [[tvOS 13]], [[watchOS 6]], a redesigned [[Mac Pro]], the [[Pro Display XDR]]<ref>{{cite web |last1=Grunin |first1=Lori |title=Apple WWDC 2019: iOS 13 dark mode, iPadOS, the Mac Pro, Pro Display XDR and all that Apple announced |url=https://www.cnet.com/news/wwdc-2019-everything-apple-announced-ios-13-dark-mode-mac-pro-macos-10-15-ipados/ |website=CNET |publisher=CNET Interactive, Inc. |accessdate=10 June 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190610111327/https://www.cnet.com/news/wwdc-2019-everything-apple-announced-ios-13-dark-mode-mac-pro-macos-10-15-ipados/ |archive-date=June 10, 2019 |url-status=live }}</ref> and the new [[Swift (programming language)|SwiftUI]] framework.
===Apple Special Event (September 10, 2019)===
Apple hosted a media event on September 10, 2019, with the tagline "By innovation only." It was held at the [[Steve Jobs Theater]] in the [[Apple Park]] campus. [[Apple TV+]] updates, [[Apple Watch#Fifth generation|Apple Watch Series 5]], [[iPhone 11]], [[iPhone 11 Pro|iPhone 11 Pro and 11 Pro Max]], and the [[iPad (2019)|7th generation iPad]] were announced.
The event was streamed live on [[YouTube]] for the first time, in addition to the usual streaming on Apple's website and through an [[Apple TV]] channel.
===Apple Special Event (December 2, 2019)===
Apple hosted a special event in [[New York City|New York]] to honor the best apps in 2019.
